Home → New Chapters: Mental health information services

New Chapters: Mental health information services

Our mental health and wellbeing service includes a blog, links to useful websites, an events list and Books on Prescription.

Open Space – Ipswich County Library timetable for 27 June - 19 September 2018

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Jun 25, 2018

Here is the new timetable for Open Space at Ipswich County Library for 27 June - 19 September 2018! Lots of exciting things coming up and some great discussions.

Reading Well for mental health

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jun 6, 2018

The Reading Agency and Society of Chief Librarians have released a new list of Reading Well books for people with mental health conditions such as depression, anxiety, OCD and eating disorders.

Wellcome longlist 2018

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 9, 2018

The 2018 Wellcome Prize longlist features memoirs, biographies, fiction and non-fiction pertaining to health and medicine.

Introducing IAGES, our new mental health partnership with Suffolk Family Carers and Suffolk Mind

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Dec 15, 2017

In April 2017, we joined up with Suffolk Family Carers and Suffolk Mind to create a new mental health service, IAGES (Information, Advice, Guidance and Emotional Support). We've been working very hard since then and we'd like to show you what we've been up to so far.

Talking Mental Health with Librarian Theatre

Written by Alice Violett · Published Nov 21, 2017

Librarian Theatre are bringing their new production, Alice in the Cuckoo's Nest, to five Suffolk Libraries this December. We asked co-artistic director Kelly Eva May about the mental health themes in this experimental adaptation of Alice in Wonderland, set in a modern day mental institution.

Reading Well for long term conditions

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jul 6, 2017

The Reading Agency and Society of Chief Librarians have released a new list of Reading Well books for people with long-term conditions such as chronic pain, arthritis and diabetes.

Wellcome longlist 2017

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 30, 2017

Are you interested in health or medicine, or simply looking for something new and different to read? The 2017 Wellcome Prize longlist features fiction and non-fiction titles across several genres.

Moodboosting books for young people 2017

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jan 10, 2017

Books for children from our Moodboosting collection.

National Self Care Week 2016 - take good care of yourself and those you care for with our resources

Written by Alice Violett · Published Nov 15, 2016

For National Self Care Week (14-20 November), we've compiled a list of library resources that will help you look after yourself and those you care for.

All About... Realise Futures

Written by Sarah Lungley · Published Jul 18, 2016

An interview with Realise Futures.

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service.

My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing.

The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!
